page.title: 17WESTWOOD MOTOR COMPANY
page.content: Over the years this building has been used as a slaughter house, jam factory, sausage factory and for the stabling of horses and delivery carts. It has been a garage from about 1922. In 1985 we employ 5 staff, working a five and a half day week - 8am. to 5pm. We sell 85000 gallons of petrol per year - present price Â£1.98 per gallon. We undertake servicing of all vehicles, accident repairs, and the recovery of vehicles. We are a Ministry of Transport Testing Station - M.O.T. cost in 1985 Â£10.70. The average time taken for servicing a car is 3 hours at a labour charge of Â£10 per hour.
